material.mattext: If the NASDAQ composite index is 2500, what would you expect the bond rate to be?

Our regression line is: y = 5096 - 491x. Since the bond rate is the explanatory variable, it is x. Thus, y = 2500 in this case. We have 2500 = 5096 - 491x and we need to solve for x. This means that x = (2500 - 5096) / (- 491) = 5.29%.
